subject: Law
title: Cybercrime and Digital Evidence
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Cybercrime and Digital Evidence.

hook.text: A hacker stole millions from a bank without leaving home. The crime scene was entirely virtual.

buildup.text: Cybercrime includes hacking, identity theft, ransomware attacks, and online fraud.

discovery.text: The Computer Fraud and Abuse Act (1986) is the main federal cybercrime law, though critics call it outdated.

twist.text: Digital evidence is fragileâ€”it can be altered, deleted, or encrypted. Preserving it requires specialized skills.

climax.text: Jurisdiction is a nightmare: a hacker in one country can attack victims in dozens of others simultaneously.

punchline.text: Crime moved online. The law is still catching up.

quiz.question: What is the main US federal law targeting cybercrime?
options: The Computer Fraud and Abuse Act
